subject: Re: JUnit Testing Code That Has System.exit(n);
msgSnippet: When I Googled for help before making my original post, I guess I assumed that prior JUnit discussions on System.exit(n) in this Yahoo group would show up
messageBody:
When I Googled for help before making my original post, I guess I
assumed that prior JUnit discussions on System.exit(n) in this Yahoo
group would show up (maybe they did but then they were deeper than I
dove). Anyway, this was my mistake, and one that I didn't want to
leave uncorrected.

So, here are links to two past discussion threads that dealt with the
System.exit(n) topic:

http://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/junit/message/8737

http://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/junit/message/1830

Thanks to those who have responded to this post. Each one has made me
think and hopefully improve. Also, your collective voice should help
me nudge the developer towards a better design :-).
